An Overnight Index Swap (OIS) is an interest-rate swap where the period floating rate in the swap is equal to a geometric average of the federal funds rate. The OIS rate refers to the floating rate portion of the swap. Hence the OIS rate is related to the average federal funds rate over the period of the obligation.
